Simulations in logistic regression

Source: R/logistic_simulation.R
logistic_simulation.Rd

Numerical simulations in logistic regression model.

Usage

logistic_simulation(
  cases,
  controls,
  maf,
  X1prob1_case = 0.7260159,
  X1prob1_control = 0.4974979,
  samplerX2_given_Y1 = arscpp::ars(f = Log_Dens_X2_given_Y1, f_prime =
    Log_Dens_X2_given_Y1_prime, xlb = -Inf, xrb = Inf, x = c(-2, 0, 2), beta0 = -5.6,
    prevalence = 0.0109492),
  samplerX2_given_Y0 = arscpp::ars(f = Log_Dens_X2_given_Y0, f_prime =
    Log_Dens_X2_given_Y0_prime, xlb = -Inf, xrb = Inf, x = c(-2, 0, 2), beta0 = -5.6,
    prevalence = 0.0109492)
)

Arguments

cases

An integer denoting the number of cases.

controls

An integer denoting the number of controls.

maf

A real number denoting the minor allele frequency.

X1prob1_case

A real number denoting the probability of X1 = 1 given Y1 = 1.

X1prob1_control

A real number denoting the probability of X1 = 1 given Y1 = 0.

samplerX2_given_Y1

An output of function arscpp::ars denoting the sampler of X2 given Y1 = 1.

samplerX2_given_Y0

An output of function arscpp::ars denoting the sampler of X2 given Y1 = 0.

Value

A list of simulated data.

References

Dey, Rounak, et al. "A fast and accurate algorithm to test for binary phenotypes and its application to PheWAS." The American Journal of Human Genetics 101.1 (2017): 37-49.
